best_practices.name: Lean startup thinking
best_practices.label: CDP-Lean-startup-thinking
best_practices.description:
Defining Minimum Marketable Feature (MMFs) and/or Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) helps evaluate hypotheses quickly before making too much investment. Both MMFs and MVPs represent the smallest thing that can be built to evaluate whether the hypothesis is valid.

best_practices.name: Innovation Accounting
best_practices.label: CDP-Innovation-Accounting
best_practices.description:
Evaluating hypotheses requires different metrics than those used to measure end-state working solutions. Innovation Accounting focuses on how to measure the intermediate and predictive business outcomes of a hypothesis both during initial incremental solution development and evaluation of the MVP.

best_practices.name: Gemba walks
best_practices.label: CDP-Gemba-walks
best_practices.description:
An experiential form of primary market research, a Gemba walk (‘Gemba’ is the place where the work is performed [2]) is a process in which the product team observes how stakeholders execute the steps and specific activities in their operational value streams to better identify opportunities for relentless improvement.

top_tech_stacks.context: Visual documentation and operational insights

best_practices.name: Customer Visits
best_practices.label: CDP-Customer-Visits
best_practices.description:
There’s no substitute for first-person observation of the daily activities of the people doing the work. Whether structured or informal, Product Managers and Product Owners are responsible for understanding how people use systems in actual work environments. They can’t do that at their desk, so there is no substitute for “getting outside the building” and observing users in their specific Solution Context.

best_practices.label: CDP-Separating-deployment-and-release
best_practices.description:

best_practices.description:

best_practices.name: Test-driven development (TDD)
best_practices.label: CDP-TDD
best_practices.description:
TDD involves writing the unit test first, then building the minimal code needed to pass the test. This leads to better design, higher quality, and increased productivity. TDD works with BDD and is more fully described here. Version control – Effective version control allows teams to recover quickly from problems and to improve quality by making sure the right components are integrated together. Aggregating assets under version control is a leading indicator of continuous integration maturity.

best_practices.name: Blue/Green deployment
best_practices.label: CDP-Blue/Green-deployment
best_practices.description:
The blue/green pattern involves two environments–live (production) and idle (staging). Changes flow continuously to the idle environment where they are staged until ready to deploy to production. At that point, a switch is flipped (a load balancer is updated for example), and the idle environment becomes the live environment, while the previous live environment becomes the new idle environment. This enables continuous delivery, zero-downtime deployment, and fast recovery from failures.

© Scaled Agile, Inc.
Include this copyright notice with the copied content.

https://www.scaledagile.com/about/about-us/permissions-faq/
Explore Training at:

best_practices.label: CDP-Failover/disaster-recovery
best_practices.description:

best_practices.name: Continuous security monitoring
best_practices.label: CDP-Continuous-security-monitoring
best_practices.description:
Security as code and penetration testing focus on preventing known vulnerabilities from getting to production. But it’s also important to test services continuously for newly discovered and reported vulnerabilities and to detect intrusions and attacks on services and infrastructure.

best_practices.name: Architect for operations
best_practices.label: CDP-Architect-for-operations
best_practices.description:
Operational needs must be considered. High loads, security attacks, and responding to incidents motivate a range of options from downgrading or removing services to adding capacity. Telemetry and logging capabilities enable organizations to better understand and further tune their architecture to meet actual usage patterns.

best_practices.name: Innovation Accounting
best_practices.label: CDP-Innovation-Accounting
best_practices.description:
Evaluating a hypothesis requires different metrics than those used to measure end-state working solutions. Innovation Accounting focuses on how to measure the intermediate and predictive business outcomes of the hypothesis during initial incremental solution development and evaluation of the Minimum Viable Product (MVP).

best_practices.name: Lean startup thinking
best_practices.label: CDP-Lean-startup-thinking
best_practices.description:
As MVPs are evaluated, hypothesis are proved or refuted. When hypotheses are refuted, the organization must decide if efforts should continue, should work stop, or should the new Epics with new hypotheses be formed to evaluate different approaches to the same strategy?

best_practices.label: CDP-Value-stream-mapping
best_practices.description:
An essential tool to improve the flow of value across the pipeline is value stream mapping. This tool provides the visibility needed to identify bottlenecks and problem areas to flow, as well as design a future state and create Enablers to improve the pipeline.
